result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed by the State requesting permission for victims to appear by Zoom for the 12/19/22 Motion hearing.
Filed by the State requesting permission for victims to appear by Zoom for the 1/31/23 Jury trial.

Motion hearing on December 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 31, 2023 at 08:30 am.
SEE MINUTES FROM THE 11/03/2022 Jury status hearing.

2:42 PM; Case called for Jury status hearing and Motion hearing.  Defendant Colin J Hogan in court, in custody.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Colin J Hogan.  Attorney Zachary A Wittchow in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty. Wittchow also notes that victims, and their families, are present in the courtroom as well as by Zoom video means for the hearing today.  Atty. Klein advises that she put the State on notice that she would be requesting an adjournment of the jury trial but would be prepared to proceed on the motion hearing today.  Atty. Wittchow confirms noting that he would be objecting to an adjournment of the trial, but will leave the ultimate decision up to the Court.  Atty. Klein outlines her reasons for the request to adjourn the jury trial, noting she would be requesting an adjournment of the trial to be in about 60 days.  Atty. Wittchow responds.  Based on the circumstances the Court will grant Atty. Klein's request to adjourn the Jury trial, and by agreement of counsel it will be set for the end of January 2023.  Court then inquires what could be addressed today with respect to the pending motions.  Atty. Wittchow believes the Court could address the State's Motion to Admit, Defense Denny Motion and Other Acts Motion, but believes Defense's Miranda Goodchild Motion should be set over to another date.  Atty. Klein agrees.

Court will first address State's Motion to Admit Evidence.  Atty. Wittchow presents arguments. Atty. Klein objects and presents arguments.  Atty. Wittchow presents additional arguments.  Atty. Klein presents additional arguments.  Court places its findings on the record.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will grant the State's Motion to Admit Evidence.

Court will next address Defense's Denny Motion.  Atty. Klein presents arguments.  Atty. Wittchow objects and presents arguments.  Court places its findings on the record.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will grant Defense's Denny Motion.  Atty. Klein requests the Court set the matter for formal hearing on her Suppression Motion.

Court will next address Defense's Other Acts Evidence Motion.  Atty. Klein presents arguments.  Atty. Wittchow objects and presents arguments. Atty. Klein presents additional arguments. Court places its findings on the record.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will grant Defense's Other Acts Evidence Motion.  Atty. Wittchow agrees and believes the hearing could take 2 hours.  Court will set the matter for formal hearing on Defendant's Motion to Suppress in December.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 31, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion in Limine filed by Atty. Klein.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions filed by Atty. Klein.

Motion hearing on November 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Jury status hearing on November 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Laboratory report filed by the State.
Jury status hearing on November 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:33 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Colin J Hogan in court, in custody.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Colin J Hogan.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Will in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes there are family of the victim present in person and via Zoom video means.  Court notes the matter is set for jury trial in November and inquires as to the status.  Atty. Klein advises she has received the State's Motion to Admit Evidence and she plans to file a Deny Motion and Motion to Admit as well, she believes the matter should be set for formal hearing on all of the motions before the jury status hearing in November.  Court has concerns about setting the matter for a motion hearing without the formal motion being filed.  Atty. Klein advises she can file her motion by 5:00 p.m. today.  State inquires if there is any way the jury status on 11/3/2022 can be moved to the afternoon and the court can address the motions as well as the jury status at the same time.  Court is able to move the jury status to 2:30 on 11/03/2022 to address the motion hearing as well.  Court will order Defense file their motions by 5:00 p.m. today.  Court also inquires as to the lab report referenced in the State's letter filed on 9/9/22.  Atty. Will advises she will work with Atty. Klein to get that lab report filed.
State's Witness List filed.
State's Notice of Motion and Motion to Admit Evidence
from the State requesting that the deadline to file a motion to admit other acts be extended to September 23, 2022. **Reviewed by Judge Reilly - extension to September 23, 2022 is approved.**
Trial Order signed by Judge Paul F. Reilly August 18, 2022.
Letter filed by the State requesting the victim be allowed to appear by Zoom for the 11/3/2022 jury status and 11/8/2022 jury trial.  **Reviewed by Judge Reilly 8/15/22 - Request granted.**
Filed by DA Victim/Witness requesting permission for the victims to appear by Zoom for the 10/10/2022 hearing.  **Reviewed by Judge Reilly 8/15/22 - Request granted.**

Jury status hearing on November 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:09 AM; Case called for Hearing. Attorney Zachary A Wittchow in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Colin J Hogan appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Colin J Hogan. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office, noting some victims appeared in person and by Zoom video.  Atty. Klein provides an update, she is seeking a status date but believes the matter can also be set for trial.  Atty. Wittchow has no objection to the request for scheduling. Court will set the matter for Jury status and Jury Trial as well as a further proceedings date.  Atty. Klein inquires if the matter can be set for trial on 11/8/22.  State is in agreement and also notes it plans to file a Motion to Admit/Other Acts.  Court will order that the State must file their motion by 09/10/2022, and parties to advise if needs to be set for formal hearing prior to the trial.  Court will also prepare and sign a pretrial order.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Jury status hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Filed by the State, requesting for victims to appear by zoom for hearing on 8/15. **Reviewed by Judge Lau - request granted.**

09:18 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Colin J Hogan in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Jessica A Klein.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court also notes there are victims present via Zoom video for today's hearing.  Atty. Klein provides an update, he was just appointed to the case and is requesting another further proceedings date in about 30-45 days.  No comment from the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
appointing Attorney Jessica Klein

Letter filed by the State requesting the victim be allowed to appear by Zoom.
**Reviewed by Judge Lau on 6/30/2022 - Approved.**
Hearing on July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:40 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Colin J Hogan in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorneys Amanda Nimmer and Ricardo Tapia.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court also notes there are victims present by Zoom video means today.  Atty. Gordon confirms and advises that one victim is also present in person as well.  Court notes the matter is before the Court on Defense counsel's motion to withdraw.  Atty. Nimmer confirms and notes there is a conflict of interest so they are requesting to withdraw.  Court will grant the motion to withdraw as counsel for Atty. Nimmer and Atty. Tapia.  Court notes the PD's office will work to appoint new counsel.  Atty. Nimmer believes 2 weeks should be enough time to have new counsel appointed.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel.  Court will also remove the July 11th hearing from the calendar.  Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Hearing on July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:14 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Colin J Hogan in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorneys Ricardo Tapia and Amanda Nimmer.   Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes there are victims present by Zoom video and in person for the hearing today.  Court also notes that defense filed a Motion to Compel Discovery and inquires if that needs to be addressed today.  Atty. Nimmer advises that she has received some of the discovery but some is still outstanding and outlines them on the record.  Court will table the motion, to be addressed at a later date if needed, to allow time for defense counsel and the ADA assigned to the case work the discovery issues out.  Atty. Nimmer provides an update with regards to the case, she needs time to review all the discovery and is requesting a further proceedings date in July.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Court notes if any evidentiary motions are filled they will be set for formal hearing into August.  Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Hearing on April 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:50 AM Defendant Colin J Hogan in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia and Amanda Nimmer.   Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Wittchow states the stipulation of the parties.  Town of Brookfield, Lt. Detective, Gwen Bruckner sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Wittchow.  Cross examination by Atty. Nimmer.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Wittchow moves for bind over.  Atty. Nimmer makes closing statements.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Atty. Nimmer states a substitution request was filed on 3/1/2022.  Date to be set before the newly assigned Judge.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. The Defendant not to use any electronic money receiving app (Venmo, etc). Defendant to have no contact with Sarah S./victim A's family memebers/witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.   Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.
